summary: This document outlines the procedures and responsibilities of a committee within Deutsche Bank, including decision-making processes, quorum requirements, and the role of the Secretary. It emphasizes the importance of documentation and the Chairman's veto rights.
keyFacts: The document details the appointment and responsibilities of a Secretary for the committee.
Decisions require a quorum of the Chairman and at least 50% of Voting Members.
A qualified majority of two-thirds is needed for decisions to be taken.
The Chairman has veto rights over committee decisions until minutes are finalized.
Procedures in the event of a tie do not apply according to the document.
